# Box

The Box component serves as a wrapper component for most of the CSS utility needs. It allows you to control styles using [style props](https://styled-system.com/api) for building UI components with [Styled System](https://styled-system.com).

<br />

![styled-system](data:image/png;base64,)

## Import

```js
import Box from '@trendmicro/react-styled-core/Box';
// or
import { Box } from '@trendmicro/react-styled-core';
```

## Usage

### Basic usage

```jsx
<Box
  backgroundColor="blue.50"
  color="blackAlpha.primary"
  display="inline-block"
  px=".875rem"
  py=".75rem"
>
  My component
</Box>
```

### Composite layout

```jsx
function Example() {
  const Light = ({ on, ...rest }) => (
    <Box
      display="inline-block"
      borderRadius="50%"
      bg={on ? '#00ff00' : '#666'}
      boxShadow={on ? '0 0 1px 2px rgba(0, 255, 0, .8)' : 'none'}
      height={16}
      width={16}
      verticalAlign="middle"
      {...rest}
    />
  );

  const playerNumber = 240;
  const playerName = '404 Not Found';
  const raceLaps = 2;
  const raceTime = '01:20.592';

  return (
    <Box display="flex">
      <Box width={4} bg="green.30" />
      <Box p={6} bg="gray.80" color="whiteAlpha.primary" flexBasis={0} flexGrow={1} maxWidth="100" px={24}>
        <Box display="flex" alignItems="flex-end">
          <Box flexBasis={0} flexGrow={1} maxWidth="100%">
            <Text
              color="#6fffff"
              fontWeight="bold"
              fontSize={48}
            >
              {playerNumber}
            </Text>
          </Box>
          <Box flexBasis="auto" flexGrow={0} width="auto">
            <Text fontSize={40}>
              {raceLaps} / {raceTime}
            </Text>
          </Box>
        </Box>
        <Box display="flex" alignItems="center" pt=".5rem">
          <Box width={0} flexBasis={0} flexGrow={1} maxWidth="100%">
            <Text fontSize="2xl" lineHeight="2xl">
              {playerName}
            </Text>
          </Box>
          <Box fontSize={24}>
            <Box width={20} />
            <Box>
              <Light m={8} />
              <Text mr={8}>REC</Text>
              <Light on m={8}/>
              <Text mr={8}>A</Text>
              <Light on m={8} />
              <Text mr={8}>B</Text>
            </Box>
          </Box>
        </Box>
      </Box>
    </Box>
  );
}
```

### `as` prop

You can use the `as` prop to change what is rendered dynamically at runtime.

```jsx
<Box
  as="button"
  backgroundColor="blue.70"
  color="whiteAlpha.primary"
  border="none"
  borderRadius="sm"
  cursor="pointer"
  px=".5rem"
  py=".25rem"
>
  Button
</Box>
```
